text.KPI name and description:
OP 01
   The Service Provider will provide the services in compliance with Security requirements
   Zero instances of any of the following:
   1. Failure to comply with Security Requirements.
   2. The Authority being issued a notice, adverse finding, penalty or found by a relevant authority to be in breach of Health and Safety and/or Environmental legislation, regulation and/or codes of practice. 
    3. The Service Provider or any Service Provider Party failing to meet Authority requirements in relation to business continuity or disaster recovery in a live or test situation as measured against the agreed Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Plan.
   4. Loss, theft and/or fraud in relation to Authority monies/property as a result of the Service Providers (including their staff and Contracting Associates) actions or omissions. 
    5. Service Provider acts or omissions resulting in the unavailability of Authority Buildings.
text.Comments:
Performance continues to improve as does confidence in the integrity of the data provided. 
   
   OP 01 failed this quarter due to a single failure on one of the 26 locations.  This was fully investigated, lessons learned & corrective action taken.  There have been no further incidents and the FCDO is satisfied that measures have been taken to avoid a repeat.

text.Comments: The Human and Social Sciences Research Capability (HSSRC) contractual reporting performance measure is not based on individual KPI scores, rather a combined score. text.Contract title and description: PROJ10011 Independent evaluation contract for the Girls’ Education Challenge Fund Phase II (GEC II)
text.KPI name and description:
Provider actively captures and shares lessons learned on own performance and has sought to improve on the last reporting period's performance.
   Percentage of KPI is measured by taking in consideration supplier’s achievement in quarterly scoring system done by FCDO: 
   • 6 = 100% Outstanding delivery with innovation and outstanding execution, well exceeding contractual requirements.
   • 5 = 83% Proactive supplier delivering efficiently and effectively above contractual expectations.
   • 4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
   • 3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.
   • 2 = 33% Some criteria met but significant improvements needed.
   1 = 16% Serious under performance. Not meeting requirements. Immediate and major changes needed
   – KPI description is a summarised version of a more detailed indicator embedded in the contract
text.Comments: The IEM seeks to improve performance wherever possible by learning from past and ongoing studies. They seek feedback from FCDO quarterly to ensure that the level of service remains at a high standard and continues to meet FCDO and other stakeholder needs

The supplier can demonstrate that, in line with timelines specified in the Method Statement, that “action is agreed upon. The action could come in the form of a positive action scheme, a pay review, the identification of training, or a change in policy.  The director who conducted the audit is responsible for the actions. All the directors then have a chance to feedback on the process and methods.” The supplier demonstrates, on a quarterly basis, that the Method Statement is being acted upon. By each performance review, the supplier provides a further report on the “Related Practices and Activities” that have transpired since contract start which demonstrate measures are being taken to meet the Tackling Workforce Inequality Key Indicator. Reporting relating to the metrics defined above are delayed by no more than 5 working days.

text.Contract title and description: BATUK Aviation - Lot One MEDEVAC
text.KPI name and description: Ground Ambulance – Helicopter Landing Site (HLS) Response. The Supplier shall ensure one available and reliable ground ambulance is available 24/7/365. To be deemed available and reliable the ground ambulance shall meet the response times as per the Statement of Requirement (SoR) and be situated at the designated landing site ready to conduct takeover of the patient from the air MEDEVAC platform to the Aga Khan Hospital, be suitably equipped and configured to continue patient care with a communication system as per the SoR, be manned by a minimum of one qualified person in pre emergency care to Level 5, be able to transfer the patient and continue care in the correct configuration, be a fully serviceable ground ambulance maintained and operated within Kenyan Road Transport Regulations and be driven by a competent driver backed up with a trained mechanic and despatch team.
text.Good target: The ground ambulance is at the Helicopter Landing Site (HLS) to meet the air MEDEVAC platform and successfully hands over the patient as confirmed by the Medical Liaison Officer.

text.Good target: Method Statement as detailed in Supplier’s response to the Social Value Question at ITT stage is kept to. The supplier can demonstrate that, in line with timelines specified in the Method Statement, that “action is agreed upon. The action could come in the form of a positive action scheme, a pay review, the identification of training, or a change in policy.  The director who conducted the audit is responsible for the actions. All the directors then have a chance to feedback on the process and methods.” The supplier demonstrates, on a quarterly basis, that the Method Statement is being acted upon. By each performance review, the supplier provides a further report on the “Related Practices and Activities” that have transpired since contract start which demonstrate measures are being taken to meet the Tackling Workforce Inequality Key Indicator. Reporting relating to the metrics defined above are delayed by no more than 5 working days.

text.Comments: During early 2023 the Grob fleet suffered two "pauses" due to separate technical issues that were the result of Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) design activity. The oversight and management of both events mitigated any safety risk due to the collaborative and collegiate approach taken by MOD and Babcock Aerospace. The joint activity was effective in creating an open and effective pathway to resolution, utilising OEM and regulatory information and guidance. The KPI non achievement was not due to poor performance and therefore no remedial activity is required. All parties agreed that the shared approach to this unique situation maintained the highest level of open reporting/safety management and effective resolution.

   b. 1 external review of products (at least 5+ years experience, but preferably more)

text.Contract title and description: CBC(PI)038 PPP MIGRATION PROVISION OF FACILITIES AND SERVICES AT THE DEFENCE ACADEMY OF THE UK-CBC(PI)038
text.KPI name and description: Management of Assets: To maintain the function of publicly owned Assets in accordance with the Contract. The Defence Academy (DA) has 158 Assets as defined by the contract. The large majority are dated from the 1940’s to the 1970’s with significant additional assets being added during the DACI contract over the last 12 years. Building types include domestic housing, large accommodation, office and training assets, lecture theatres, laboratories and workshops along with a range of utility and storage assets, carparks and infrastructure all of which has to be maintained.
